results.title: Talking Trade
results.creator_credit: Monica Pellizzari, Kay Donovan, Australia. Office of Multicultural Affairs and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Looks at ways Australia could expand trade to other countries, particularly the Arab world, by drawing on the language skills of its ethnic population. The video looks at examples of industries and individuals who have benefited by acknowledging their cultural roots, maintaining their language and recognising their own potential, for the key to trade with other countries is communication and understanding of other cultures. Accompanied by Teacher’s notes.

results.title: The Rocky Horror picture show (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jim Sharman, Michael White and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The film begins with our innocent pair of lovers, Brad and Janet, stranded in a rain storm with the only available shelter being the weird Dr. Frank N. Furter mansion. Before the night is out Brad and Janet will lose their respective virginities to the Doctor, be introduced to his muscle-bound creation, Rocky, and battle the evil beings from the planet Transylvania. The plot is ridiculous, the music enjoyable and the whole thing is an outrageously good time. Possibly the most popular cult movie of all time and based on the original stage musical by Richard O’Brien. With Richard O’Brien, Susan Sarandon, Nell Campbell and Patricia Quinn all doing the “Time warp”. Tim Curry steals the show with an over-the-top performance as the sex mad Doctor.

results.title: Maytime
results.creator_credit: Robert Z Leonard, Hunt Stromberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Jeanette MacDonald stars as Marcia, an opera singer in Paris who falls in love with a penniless American voice student (Nelson Eddy). Unfortunately she has just accepted a marriage proposal from an egocentric voice teacher, Nazaroff, played by John Barrymore. Years later, when chance reunites the two lovers, the enraged Nazaroff grants them their freedom… but in his own way.

results.title: Babar. Babar's First Step. City Ways. (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Raymond Jafelice, Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Clifford Ross Co and Nelvana
results.brief_description: Animated versions of two stories about Babar, King of the Elephants. “Babar’s first step” tells how Babar’s mother was killed by a hunter when he was very young leaving Babar to cope on his own. “City ways” tells how he fled to the city which he found dangerous and confusing until an old lady tried to teach him how to fit into her world. Adapted from the picture books by Jean and Laurent de Brunhoff.

results.title: Annie Hall
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Charles H. Joffe and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Woody Allen’s satire on the comic anxiety between the sexes in contemporary relationships. When Alvy Singer (Woody Allen), a neurotic night-club comedian, meets Annie Hall (Diane Keaton), a budding cabaret singer, a nervous romance begins. Also stars Colleen Dewhurst
results.creator_credit_for_label: Woody Allen, Charles H. Joffe and United Artists Corporation

results.title: Paris, Texas
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Anatole Dauman, Don Guest, Argos Films and Road Movies
results.brief_description: Travis (Harry Dean Stanton) is travelling aimlessly through Texas, having left behind his son in LA with his successful brother Walt (Dean Stockwell). But Travis decides to go back for his son and take him along on a journey to find the boy’s mother (Nastassja Kinski). Their search ends in a cheap strip- joint and Travis and his ex-wife confront each other about lost dreams and past betrayals. Visually striking, and intellectually stimulating, “Paris, Texas” is scripted by Sam Shepard and based on his own volume of short stories, “Motel chronicles”. The haunting musical score is by Ry Cooder.

results.title: The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp
results.creator_credit: Emeric Pressburger, Michael Powell, Rank Film Productions and The Archers
results.brief_description: The producing and directing team of Powell and Pressburger resulted in some of British cinema’s finest films. “Colonel Blimp” is a deeply romantic film, but its emotionalism is kept in check by the cast’s English reserve. During the Boer War a young English soldier meets a German soldier and they are to continue a friendship that will take them through three wars on opposite sides of battle. Deborah Kerr features as the woman they both love. Also stars Roger Livesey and Roland Culver.

results.title: Night Moves
results.creator_credit: Arthur Penn, Robert Sherman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Gene Hackman plays private detective Harry Moseby who is hired by an ex- actress to find her teenage runaway daughter. Moseby’s hunt for the missing teenager takes him deep into mystery, double-cross, violence and smuggling. A homage to film-noir, “Night Moves” is also a bleak, stylish examination of alienation and greed in contemporary America.
